result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth A Twyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time - commences forthwith, 94 days credit
Costs to be paid $100.00 a month commencing 01/01/2023 and the 1st of each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment
Case 21CF1155 is dismissed and read in

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Kenneth A Twyman.  Attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to sole count. Court conducts colloquy with the Defendant and finds them guilty of the charge. Case 21CF1155 is dismissed and read-in to this case. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:	
180 Days in the Waukesha County Jail, Straight-time.
94 Days Credit.

Costs:  $268.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month, starting  01/01/2023 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: entry of civil judgment
 
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:32 AM Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Kenneth A Twyman.  Attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. There are no victims. 

Defense has filed a plea questionnaire, and requests a plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:43 AM Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Kenneth A Twyman.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense is in receipt of discovery, and emailed a counter offer to responsible DA, but has not heard back from the State. Defense requests another date in 2-3 weeks. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

10:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Kenneth A Twyman. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If the defendant has a passport the defendant is to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.

01:15 PM Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court, in custody with State Public Defender Intern Patrick Sicula.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.
